data: cottage [laugh] huddled on the edge of the Whispering Woods, its stone walls worn smooth by centuries of wind

and rain. Inside, old [pause] Elara lived a quiet life, her days filled with tending her herb garden and the gentle creak of her rocking chair. Her only companions were the rustling leaves outside and the memories that danced in the embers of her hearth.

One crisp autumn evening, as the moon hung like a sliver of polished bone in the inky sky, a frantic scratching echoed at Elaraâ€™s door. Her heart, accustomed to the slow rhythm of solitude, gave a surprised
flutter. [sad] No one ever came to her door, especially not after dusk.
